nodes.title: Potion of Incorporeal Passage
nodes.content:
A pale, silvery liquid that seems to shimmer and waver like a ghostly apparition contained in a slender, delicate glass bottle. The bottle is sealed with a glass stopper and a metallic pattern is etched into the glass.

For one minute, the drinker is transformed into a ghostly mist and gains the ability to pass through solid objects such as doors or walls no thicker than one foot. Once the passage is made, the effect ends immediately. If passage is attempted through a material too thick, the drinker takes 3d10 force damage and returns to the spot they started from.

 ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=e81fb4ac-a04b-4cf1-aaaa-158035b27677)


---

- [x] Homebrew source [Dungeon Church](https://5e.dungeon.church/items.html#potion%20of%20incorporeal%20passage_dungeonchurch)

\

nodes.title: Void Essence
nodes.content:
An obsidian bottle, its surface polished to a mirror like sheen that reflects a dark, distorted image. The bubbling liquid inside appears to be boiling, but it is as cold as ice water and smells of carrion and ozone.

Any who manage to quaff it feel a bone-chilling cold, like the touch of death spreading through their veins, gaining resistance to necrotic damage and vulnerability to radiant damage for one hour.

 ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=c729e446-2745-4641-aa46-a39389b6a90c)

nodes.title: Brooch of Witchsight
nodes.content:
####  ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=e6f48607-ea1e-4981-b8a2-4a4e68c7b850 "right-50")Brooch of Witchsight

Very rare, major tier


---

This ornate brooch is crafted from a dark metal clutching its centerpiece gem - a mesmerizing sapphire that pulses with a spectral light. Inside the gem is a crystalized, unblinking human eyeball - about the size of a child’s.

***Witchsight.*** While wearing and attuned to the brooch, the wearer gains Witchsight and can see magical ley lines as glowing paths or streams of energy that traverse the land within a range of 100’.

***Navigate the Arcane.*** The wearer gains advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to navigate or understand the properties of magical locations, including detecting the presence of nearby portals, enchantments, or areas of strong magical influence.

***Attunement.*** To attune to the brooch, you must spend a Long Rest meditating on the arcane in an area where ley lines are present.


---

nodes.title: Quake 3 Arena Server
nodes.content:
![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=f097d39e-f384-4027-a4be-f22311363aad)Objectively the best internet pew pew game to play with your friends, we have a death match server running at `dungeon.church:27960`

Curated fantasy-themed map rotation and some familiar NPC bots.

# ioQuake Setup

ioQuake3 is a free game engine that runs on Mac / Windows / Linux computers. You need to install the engine, then add the game files.


:::info
They have a [Player Guide](https://ioquake3.org/help/players-guide) here with more details.

:::


1. [Download and install ioQuake3](https://ioquake3.org/) app![Map: Ecstatica](/api/attachments.redirect?id=08b6cad8-39a2-4e5f-b34e-20684fbe8960 "right-50 =337x253")
2. [Download the patch update](https://files.ioquake3.org/quake3-latest-pk3s.zip) from iD Software and unzip it.
3. :pirate_flag::shushing_face: [Download the actual game file](http://quake.dungeon.church/baseq3/pak0.pk3) `pak0.pk3`
4. Go to the Quake 3 application folder. On a Mac, use Finder to *Go→Go to Folder* & navigate to `~/Library/Application Support/Quake3`. Put the *pak0.pk3* game file in `baseq3`
5. Take the two folders there were in the patch zip (`baseq3` & `missionpack`) and copy the pk3 files into the appropriate subfolders in the application folder.
6. Start the game, if it asks for a CD Key, use: `RC7GSLHWJP2B3TAD`
7. At this point you will probably want to go into the settings and mess around with resolution etc. and set up your player. One required setting (to download the custom maps) you need to have *Setup→Game Options→Automatic Downloads* turned `on`

### Join Server

:partying_face: You can now go to *Multiplayer→Specify* and enter address `dungeon.church` to join

### Optional

* Improve the graphics with [Neural Upscale Textures](https://www.moddb.com/mods/quake-3-neural-upscale/addons) mod![Map: Windsong Keep](/api/attachments.redirect?id=a5b04c6e-58b5-4e02-b900-1f853b6978bd "right-50 =224x168")
* [Additional Player Skins](https://www.moddb.com/games/quake-iii-arena/addons/quake-3-model-pack)
* In the game console (accessed in Quake 3 by pressing the \~ key), you can enter additional commands to improve performance on modern computers:
  * `/snaps 40`
  * `/rate 2500`
  * `/cl_maxpackets 125`
  * `/com_maxfps 125`
  * `/com_hunkMegs 512`
  * and to bookmark our server `/seta server1 dungeon.church:27960`
* If you have a widescreen monitor [Flexible HUD mod](https://clover.moe/flexible-hud-for-ioq3/) will fix the menus

# GameTracker Stats

[Link](https://www.gametracker.com/server_info/192.9.236.115:27960/) - keeps track of player stats

[https://www.gametracker.com/server%5Finfo/dungeon.church:27960/](https://www.gametracker.com/server%5Finfo/dungeon.church:27960/)

# Additional Resources

nodes.title: Kierst Issel
nodes.content:
[DnD_5E_CharacterSheet_FormFillable.pdf 1135828](/api/attachments.redirect?id=4354462b-fb97-443b-a4c2-b06feaaa25ad)

Kierst Issel is a 3rd level Human rogue - arcane trickster.

\
Kierst’s story is as follows:

Kierst Issel was a member of an old aristocratic family of Stribourg origins who were once members of the court of the Hierophant of Stribourg and who, in a moment of weakness, tried to stop the Hierophant from killing a family friend who was a rival to the Hierophant in business affairs.

The family was banished from the court as a result and their business was blacklisted among the elite. Kierst, then just a 15 year old, remembers the fall from grace bitterly as his prospects at education and life in society fell precipitously.  Fortunately he still had enough contacts to be invited to some social events and he turned to daring heists of jewelry, rare manuscripts, and purported magic items to help pay the debts his family held now that their business prospects fell.  He has recently left town for a period as some evidence has started to point to him as a perpetrator of the latest heist.

nodes.title: Noctael the Chain Bearer
nodes.content:
Noctael the Chain Bearer had once been a wayward tiefling, curious from the curling tips of his horns to the restless flick of his slender tail. On a moonless eve, he trailed dancing wisps into the labyrinthine heart of the Feywild, where every breath reeked of lilac and cunning. There, amid brambly groves and silken illusions, he fell prey to the twisted whims of a capricious sprite queen and her thorn-crowned courtiers, whose razor-edged songs lured him deeper into the shadows.\n\nDesperate to break free, he made a dark bargain with a fiend lurking just beyond their court’s flickering torches, bartering away the last vestiges of his mortal innocence for infernal chains that bound both body and soul. When he finally stumbled back into the mortal realm, crimson radiance flared in his eyes, and the clank of unholy iron rang out with every step. No longer the tiefling wanderer he had been, Noctael slipped through villages like a wolf stalking lambs—silent but for the scraping of those grim shackles, ever watched by his dread patron in the gloom.

\

nodes.title: Jethro Honeyrock
nodes.content:
Halfling (Stout)

Rogue

\
What does it mean to fit in? Is it becoming an amalgamation of your surroundings as to not stand out? Or is it deliberately crafting a new personality for yourself to perfectly both contrast *and* match the new micro-society you’ll be joining?

Jethro believes it’s the latter.

\
Jethro Honeyrock has travelled far and wide, not truly finding a place to settle down. From sneaking in and staying at a forgotten bedroom at an inn, to making makeshift shelters to scrape by in hidden alleyways. He's been sure to not get too tied down to one place or another, as when he'd run a gambling grift and be found out, he'd skip town. If he found himself with a bit of a gambling debt on his head, he'd also skip town.

He's a good bit shorter than the average dwarf, with a noticeably scrawnier stature, too. He hides it well, however, typically wearing a large, baggy cloak over his regular doubled-up garb to look bulkier than normal. When he'd skip town, he'd reinvent his appearance the best he can while still trying to look dwarf-like, from changing up his intricate beard braids, swapping out his entire wardrobe, to making more rash decisions such as intentionally giving himself a scar on his face when fleeing an especially bad situation.

Jethro's gambling related activities have slowed down after his most recent gambling run. For months, he played and cheated in an underground game run by The Queen's Men, but eventually his gambling grift went sideways. He found himself losing a lot of the money he had earned, specifically to a dwarf named Bhardok. When he somehow started to lose more than he won in a game rigged *in his* favor, Jethro started to get antsy and look for a way out.

\

nodes.title: Directions to Brad's Studio
nodes.content:
# Cotton Mills Studios in Fruitvale

* [1091 Calcot Place, Oakland, CA 94606](https://www.google.com/maps/place/1091+Calcot+Pl,+Oakland,+CA+94606/@37.7981586,-122.2419963,17z/data=!4m5!3m4!1s0x808f86e66880231f:0xc4ebb81204f63886!8m2!3d37.7816762!4d-122.2381794)
* It’s in a weird spot - you go underneath the 23rd Street overpass on Calcot Place, sandwiched between 880 and the train tracks

  ### Parking
* Secure guest parking is available in the lot, ping Brad on Discord to open the gate. Guest parking is in the back right painted as “GUEST” spots. 
* :skull_and_crossbones: **DO NOT PARK IN NUMBERED SPOTS** :skull_and_crossbones:

# From Transit

The Cotton Mill is only about 1 mile from Fruitvale BART station, however it goes through a pedestrian-unfriendly, industrial part of the neighborhood with a lot of encampments so I would not recommend walking it. It is perfectly fine to bike/scooter/etc. though! 

 ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=547e027e-68c4-40c0-8ecc-3e50aba7c2ec)

[Google Maps: Fruitvale to Cotton Mill Studios via Walk/Bike](https://www.google.com/maps/dir/37.7813835,-122.2378542/Fruitvale+BART,+Oakland,+CA+94601/@37.7776882,-122.2352504,16z/data=!4m10!4m9!1m1!4e1!1m5!1m1!1s0x808f86f4a3f0d739:0x60fc93ed71a391b0!2m2!1d-122.225206!2d37.7752293!3e1?entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI0MDkwNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D)

# Cycling Directions

Please take a look at map before you leave. Because of the train track overpass, going from East 12th Street → 23rd Avenue is a dangerous/bad route for bikes (no shoulder, limited visibility hill, high speed traffic getting to 880, rough road surface, etc).

### Very Bad No Good Intersection

The intersection at 23rd Ave turning onto E 11th St / Calcot Place is very poorly designed and people constantly blow the lights at high speed. Be careful! Never assume the cars are going to stop.

 ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=5452d24f-0d57-4239-8b2f-d6d520989b48)

### From Downtown Headed East

* [Google Link: Lake Merritt BART to 1091 Calcot Place via Bike](https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Lake+Merritt+Station,+800+Oak+St,+Oakland,+CA+94607/1091+Calcot+Pl,+Oakland,+CA+94606-5044,+USA/@37.7898052,-122.2556352,16.19z/data=!4m19!4m18!1m10!1m1!1s0x808f80cb294063c9:0xb6198c573126a242!2m2!1d-122.2652155!2d37.7970287!3m4!1m2!1d-122.2590238!2d37.7922871!3s0x808f872e03cc9e49:0xc057dc92c8095608!1m5!1m1!1s0x808f86e66880231f:0xc4ebb81204f63886!2m2!1d-122.2381794!2d37.7816762!3e1)
* Take Embarcadero (aka “Bay Trail” route) to 23rd Avenue, cross 880 freeway via bike lane on overpass on 23rd. Take a right onto confusingly signed “E 11 St / Miller Place” which immediately becomes Calcot Place as you go left and under 23rd Ave.

  ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=8c62d87c-26ae-4b86-887c-56db575c5c1a)

  ### From Fruitvale Station Headed West
* [Google Link: Fruitvale BART to 1091 Calcot Place via Bike](https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Fruitvale+BART,+Oakland,+CA/1091+Calcot+Pl,+Oakland,+CA+94606-5044,+USA/@37.776886,-122.2329674,16.38z/data=!4m24!4m23!1m15!1m1!1s0x808f86f4a3f0d739:0x60fc93ed71a391b0!2m2!1d-122.225206!2d37.7752293!3m4!1m2!1d-122.2319972!2d37.7764991!3s0x808f86edfaa3d1d9:0xe6f9d1347390eb74!3m4!1m2!1d-122.2334449!2d37.7781265!3s0x808f86ee5a5706a3:0x149631eece763fea!1m5!1m1!1s0x808f86e66880231f:0xc4ebb81204f63886!2m2!1d-122.2381794!2d37.7816762!3e1)
* Head west from Fruitvale on E 12th Street, take a left onto 29th Avenue and cross the train tracks. Keep going until just before freeway entrance, and take a right on E 10th Street at the light (past the animal shelter on right, opposite the school on your left). nodes.title: Potion of Unbridled Potential
nodes.content:
*Rare, 1lb*

This small bottle contains a boiling, iridescent liquid that seems to change colors unpredictably. Captured within this elixir is the raw chaos of magic itself, a boiling miasma of uncontrollable energy. When uncorked, the bottle emits whispers of ancient incantations and forgotten spells, tempting the drinker with the promise of untold power that only they can discover. Giving in to this temptation produces one roll on the [Wild Magic Surge](https://lore.dungeon.church/doc/wild-magic-qxCCjiqddc#h-wild-magic-surge-1\\) table.

nodes.title: stuff
nodes.content:
# eliander

Since you are from Striborg you would have heard ballads and legends about a leader in the armed forces named Eliander Fireborn, known as kind of a philosopher gladiator, a badass fighter who speaks a dozen languages and (of particular interest to you) is known for collecting rare books on his adventures. He lost his leg (the subject of competing and contradictory legends) and so now hobbles around on a wooden peg leg. It is common knowledge he was rewarded with a plush retirement gig overseeing the town guard in Saltmarsh, a reward from the bureaucracy of Striborg for his service.

\
# Researcher

## Background Feature

When you attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if you do not know that information, you often know where and from whom you can obtain it. Usually, this information comes from a library, scriptorium, university, or a sage or other learned person or creature. Your DM might rule that the knowledge you seek is secreted away in an almost inaccessible place, or that it simply cannot be found. Unearthing the deepest secrets of the multiverse can require an adventure or even a whole campaign.

nodes.title: Animated Bearskin Rug
nodes.content:
*Large Construct, unaligned*


___

* **Armor Class** 13 (natural armor)
* **Hit Points** 65 (`10d10 + 10`)
* **Speed** 20 ft.


___

| STR | DEX | CON | INT | WIS | CHA |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| 18 (+4) | 13 (+1) | 12 (+1) | 1 (-5) | 3 (-4) | 1 (-5) |


___

* **Damage Immunities** poison, psychic
* **Condition Immunities** blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
* **Senses** blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6
* **Languages** —
* **Challenge** 4 (1,100 XP)
* **Proficiency Bonus** +2


___

***Antimagic Susceptibility.*** The bearskin rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

***Damage Transfer.*** While it is grappling a creature, the bearskin rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

***False Appearance.*** While the bearskin rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal bearskin rug.

### Actions

***Multiattack.*** The animated bearskin rug makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws. It can use its Envelop in place of its claw attack.

***Bite.*** Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (`1d10 + 4`) piercing damage.

***Claws.*** Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target not grappled by the bearskin rug. Hit: 9 (`1d10 + 4`) piercing damage.

***Envelop.*** Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is grappled (escaped DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the rug can't envelop another target.

***Menacing Roar (Recharge 6).*** Each creature within 20 feet of the rug that can hear the roar must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature frightened this way must spend its turns trying to move as far away from the rug as it can. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action. At the end of each of its turns and when it takes damage, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

## Animated Bearskin Rug

 ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=c0294267-8bd8-42fe-b100-8e478f911231 "right-50")*A shaggy rug made from the skin of a bear suddenly rises up like a billowing sheet. The head snaps its jaws and the whole thing lunges forward, flat and threatening.*

***Inn Protection.*** Inns and hunting lodges in remote locations often hire mages to make animated bearskin rugs. The rugs serve as seemingly harmless decorations that can instantly turn into guardians to drive away burglars, or into bouncers to break up bar fights.

***Bearserk.*** There are rare cases of animated bearskin rugs suddenly going berserk and refusing to follow the commands of their masters. It is unknown what triggers such violence in the constructs. Berserk rugs need to be put down swiftly, as they attack any creature they notice.

***Construct Nature.*** An animated bearskin rug doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.


---

- [x] [Source: Tome of Beasts 2, page 24](https://5e.dungeon.church/bestiary.html#animated%20bearskin%20rug_tob2)

nodes.title: Ironsworn Rules & Reference
nodes.content:
![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=d08e9987-4216-44a7-a705-f445f7dfabd0)

[Ironsworn](https://www.ironswornrpg.com/) is a solo or co-op RPG of perilous quests by [Shawn Tomkin](https://linktr.ee/shawntomkin) that is free. In Ironsworn, your character is sworn to undertake tasks and seek out bonds in a dark fantasy setting using a simple, “fiction first” system.

Ironsworn is great for worldbuilding, downtime activities, a writing aide, or fleshing out your character’s story.

nodes.content:
####  ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=ef5b8f74-b635-4c82-86b7-9e6b54e2d675 "right-50")Dagger of Profuse Bleeding

Weapon (dagger), very rare, simple weapon, melee weapon, 1 lb.

1d4 piercing  - finesse, light, thrown (20/60 ft.)


---

This obsidian dagger has a wicked, serrated edge to it that rends flesh as it cuts.

***Wicked Edge.*** When you hit a creature with this magic weapon, it causes the target to bleed profusely at even the slightest injury. Because of the amount of blood, they are unable to heal themselves by medicine or magic on their next turn.

***Finesse.*** When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

***Light.*** A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

***Thrown.*** If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.


---

**Air Form.** The rotting wind can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

**Befouling Presence.** All normal plant life and liquid in the same space as a rotting wind at the end of the wind's turn is blighted and cursed. Normal vegetation dies in 1d4 days, while plant creatures take double damage from the wind of decay action. Unattended liquids become noxious and undrinkable.

**Invisibility.** The rotting wind is [invisible](https://5e.tools/conditionsdiseases.html#invisible_phb) as per a greater invisibility spell.

### Actions

**Wind of Decay.** *Melee Weapon Attack:* +8 to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. *Hit:* 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with tomb rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or comparable magic.


---

 ![](/api/attachments.redirect?id=f456f73c-ec96-4151-b546-ccb24e3abd92)*A rotting wind brings a chilling gust to the air, turning nearby foliage to rot and raising a sense of dread in all creatures in its path.*

####  Air of Tombs.

A rotting wind is an undead creature made up of the foul air and grave dust sloughed off by innumerable undead creatures within lost tombs and grand necropoli.

#### Scouts for Undead Armies.

A rotting wind carries the foul stench of death upon it, sometimes flying before undead armies and tomb legions or circling around long-extinct cities and civilizations.

#### Withering Crops.

Rotting winds sometimes drifts mindlessly across a moor or desert, blighting all life they find and leaving only famine and death in its wake. This is especially dangerous when they drift across fields full of crops; they can destroy an entire harvest in minutes.


---

___

***Keen Smell.*** The giant ant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

### Actions

***Multiattack.*** The giant ant makes one Bite attack and one Sting attack.

***Bite.*** Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (`1d8 + 2`) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the giant ant can't Bite a different target.

***Sting.*** Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (`1d8 + 2`) piercing damage. The target must make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

## Giant Ant

Several pony-sized ants swarm around an ant the size of a draft horse, clacking their serrated mandibles and threatening with their stingers.

Giant ants look much like a normal ant with six legs, a waspish segmented body, and large antenna. Their hides are covered in thick chitin, and they have large, serrated mandibles flanking their mouths and stingers on their tails. These stingers are the size of a shortsword, and they're capable of stabbing and poisoning a human to death.

***Colony Defenders.*** Giant ants form colonies under the control of a queen much like their normal-sized cousins. Sterile females form castes with the workers building the nest and caring for larvae. Queens and male drones rarely leave the colony. Soldiers defend the colony and forage for food.

***Carry Prey Home.*** Giant ants are both predators and scavengers, working in organized groups to bring down large prey and carry it back to the nest. Giant ants tend to ignore animals away from the colony when not foraging for food, but they quickly move to overwhelm prey when hungry or threatened. A giant ant stands nearly four feet tall and weighs 400 pounds, while a giant ant queen is over five feet tall and weighs 900 pounds. Giant ants communicate with each other primarily with pheromones but also use sound and touch.

***Lightning Absoprtion.*** Whenever the briar mound would take lightning damage, it instead takes no damage and regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

***Thorny Defense.*** A creature that touches the briar mound or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (`2d4`) piercing damage.

### Actions

***Multiattack.*** The briar mound makes two attacks.

***Slam.*** *Melee Weapon Attack:* +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. *Hit:* 14 (`3d6 + 4`) bludgeoning damage.

***Engulf.*** The briar mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 saving throw at the start of each of the briar mound's turns or take 13 (`2d8 + 4`) bludgeoning damage. If the briar mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The briar mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

nodes.title: Bag of Rust
nodes.content:
*Wondrous item, uncommon, major tier, ½ lb.*


---

This ordinary leather bag appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals a handful of rust powder.

Once a day, you can use an action to pull rust powder from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. The powder cloud transforms into a creature you determine by rolling a d8 and consulting the table.

The creature is friendly to you and your companions, and it acts on your turn. You can use a bonus action to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, or to give it general orders, such as to attack your enemies. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature. 

Creatures summoned this way are resistant to necrotic damage.

The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 hit points. At that point, the bag can be used again.
